contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Hokubō'''|北房町|Hokubō-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Jōbō District, Okayama|Jōbō District]], [[Okayama Prefecture|Okayama]], [[Japan]]. On March 31, 2005 Hokubō was merged with the towns of [[Katsuyama, Okayama|Katsuyama]], [[Ochiai, Okayama|Ochiai]], [[Yubara, Okayama|Yubara]] and [[Kuse, Okayama|Kuse]], and the villages of [[Mikamo, Okayama|Mikamo]], [[Kawakami, Okayama (Maniwa)|Kawakami]], [[Yatsuka, Okayama|Yatsuka]] and [[Chūka, Okayama|Chūka]], all from [[Maniwa District, Okayama|Maniwa District]], to form the new city of [[Maniwa, Okayama|Maniwa]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 6,158 and a [[population density|density]] of 86.51 persons per km². The total area was 71.18 km². {{DEFAULTSORT:Hokubo, Okayama}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Okayama Prefecture]] {{Okayama-geo-stub}}
